definition: tug-of-war/to take part in a tug-of-war
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: When we played tug-of-war today, a tooth of mine fell out.
sentences.chinese: 今天玩拔河的時候，一顆牙齒掉下來了。

sentences.english: Love is like a game of tug-of-war competition, not stop to the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 愛就像是一場拔河比賽，一開始就不能停下來。

sentences.english: Sam and John are pulling the rope.
I didn't have a prayer of winning a tug-of-war with Emmett.
sentences.chinese: 我根本沒指望能在與埃米特的拔河比賽中獲勝。

sentences.english: The tradition of turkey bone tug-of-war goes back a long way.
sentences.chinese: 用火雞骨拔河的傳統由來已久。

sentences.english: Tug-of-war is also one of the most popular sports in China.
sentences.chinese: 而拔河應該算是大家最喜聞樂見的一項體育活動。

sentences.english: There are many different ways to compete ancient tug-of-war contests.
sentences.chinese: 古老的拔河比賽有許多不同的進行方式。

sentences.english: They win the 11)tug-of-war of fighting fate.
sentences.chinese: 他們在與命運的拔河中贏了。

sentences.english: The tug-of-war ended when both teams tumbled.
sentences.chinese: 拔河賽因兩隊跌倒而竣事。

sentences.english: We beat the seniors in the tug-of-war!
sentences.chinese: 我們在拔河比賽中贏了高年級隊。

sentences.english: Thee tug-of-war ended when both teams tumbled.
sentences.chinese: 拔河賽因兩隊跌倒而結束。

sentences.english: The tug-of-war ended when both teams tumbled.
sentences.chinese: 拔河賽因兩隊跌倒而結束。

sentences.english: It was like a game of tug-of-war.
In a push-and-pull game, both teams strained hard and were neck and neck in the competition.
sentences.chinese: 拔河場上，兩隊人員都繃着勁，使比賽一時難分勝負。

sentences.english: These include the sports of golf and tug of war.
sentences.chinese: 這其中就包括高爾夫球和拔河比賽。

sentences.english: Actually it's similar to the tug-of-war.
sentences.chinese: 原來是這樣，有點像拔河比賽啊。

definition: pole-climbing (as gymnastics or circus act)/climbing pole
